title: 106_s3
content:
The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" includes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. This amendment does not affect the tax rate for purposes of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $43,050: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $43,050 but not over $104,050: $5,811.75 plus 25.2% of the excess over $43,050
- Over $104,050 but not over $158,550: $21,183.75 plus 27.9% of the excess over $104,050
- Over $158,550 but not over $283,150: $36,389.25 plus 32.4% of the excess over $158,550
- Over $283,150: $76,759.65 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. Heads of Households have a separate tax table. The tax rates based on taxable income for unmarried individuals are as follows:
- Not over $34,550: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $34,550 but not over $89,150: $4,664.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $34,550
- Over $89,150 but not over $144,400: $18,423.45 plus 27.9% of the excess over $89,150
- Over $144,400 but not over $283,150: $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of the excess over $144,400
- Over $283,150: $78,793.20 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. The tax rates for unmarried individuals are based on taxable income and are as follows:
- Not over $34,550: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $34,550 but not over $89,150: $4,664.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $34,550
- Over $89,150 but not over $144,400: $18,423.45 plus 27.9% of the excess over $89,150
- Over $144,400 but not over $283,150: $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of the excess over $144,400
- Over $283,150: $78,793.20 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. For married individuals filing separate returns, the tax rates are as follows:
- Not over $25,750: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $25,750 but not over $62,450: $3,476.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $25,750
- Over $62,450 but not over $130,250: $12,724.65 plus 27.9% of the excess over $62,450
- Over $130,250 but not over $283,150: $31,640.85 plus 32.4% of the excess over $130,250
- Over $283,150: $81,180.45 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. The tax rates for taxable income for estates and trusts are as follows:
- Not over $21,525: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $21,525 but not over $52,025: $2,905.87 plus 25.2% of the excess over $21,525
- Over $52,025 but not over $79,275: $10,591.87 plus 27.9% of the excess over $52,025
- Over $79,275 but not over $141,575: $18,194.62 plus 32.4% of the excess over $79,275
- Over $141,575: $38,379.82 plus 35.64% of the excess over $141,575. The tax rates for taxable income for estates and trusts are as follows:
- Not over $1,750: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $1,750 but not over $4,050: $236.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $1,750
- Over $4,050 but not over $6,200: $815.85 plus 27.9% of the excess over $4,050
- Over $6,200 but not over $8,450: $1,415.70 plus 32.4% of the excess over $6,200
- Over $8,450: $2,144.70 plus 35.64% of the excess over $8,450. Inflation adjustments have been made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Inflation adjustment conforming amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include changing dates from 1992 to 1998 in various sections. In the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, various sections are amended to change dates from 1992 to 1998. Various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to change dates from 1992 to 1998. Additionally, there are conforming amendments to adjust percentages in different sections of the Code. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change dates from 1992 to 1998, with adjustments to percentages in different sections of the Code for taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998. Section 3406(a)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to change the percentage from "31 percent" to "27.9 percent" for taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998. Amendments to withholding provisions will apply to amounts paid after the same date.
